key_title: Key to the genera of Potamogetonaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Potamogetonaceae (including Ruppiaceae)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Potamogetonaceae (including Ruppiaceae). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers bisexual, in long emergent spikes; perianth absent, 4 sepaloid scales opposite stamens; anthers sessile, 2 or 4

Flowers unisexual, solitary or clustered in axis, remaining submerged; perianth absent or of 3 small scales or cup-like; 1 stamen or 2–3 stamens fused forming a single anther mass, anther mass sessile or on filament
Leaf sheath almost completely free from leaf; ligule absent; leaves sub-orbicular, narrowly ovate to linear, greater than 3 mm wide
Leaf sheath basally united with base of leaf, distally free and extended into a distinct ligule; leaves linear, less than 2 mm wide
Basal leaf sheath adenate to leaf blade; male flowers with perianth of 3 small scales or cup-like perianth, anther mass ± sessile; female flowers with perianth of 3 scales, carpels 3
Basal leaf sheath free from leaf blade; male flowers lacking perianth, anther mass on filament; female flowers with cup-like perianth, usually with 3 carpels, but often 1–9
